alert.note: Alert for De Soto; Natchitoches; Red River; Winn (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 11 at 10:17AM CDT until May 11 at 1:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Winn Parish in north central Louisiana... Southeastern De Soto Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Northern Natchitoches Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Red River Parish in northwestern Louisiana... * Until 115 PM CDT. * At 1017 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Winnfield, Coushatta, Campti, Allen, Martin, Clarence, Goldonna, Dodson, Ashland, Calvin, Edgefield, Powhatan, Creston, Chestnut, Black Lake, Clear Lake, Lake End, Hanna, Armistead and Joyce. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: De Soto; Natchitoches; Red River; Winn
